body:
Full source here: [http://www.vim.org/scripts/download_script.php?src_id=10391](http://www.vim.org/scripts/download_script.php?src_id=10391)

The line is:

	    silent %s/[^λ←→≲≳≡≠⇒»∙∀\\\-!#$%&*+/<=>?@\^|~.]\@<=\\\([^λ←→≲≳≡≠⇒»∙∀\\\-!#$%&*+/<=>\?@\^|~.]\)/λ\1/eg
	

Someone please decipher this for me. The larger script is intended to unicode-ify some operators in Haskell into more familiar mathematical equivalents.
title: What in the world does this vimscript do?
